snippet: In a country that has long tolerated brazen corruption in its leaders, tears of despair and suicides followed the sentencing of the Tamil Nadu chief minister, Jayalalithaa Jayaram.
abstract: Officials of Indian state of Tamil Nadu weep at swearing-in ceremony for successor to Jayalalithaa Jayaram, chief minister who has been sentenced to prison on corruption charges; Jayaram, known as Amma, or Mother, has become first sitting state leader to come under new Supreme Court ruling that bars her from remaining in office while appealing a conviction.
lead_paragraph: In a country that has long tolerated brazen corruption in its leaders, tears of despair and suicides followed the sentencing of the Tamil Nadu chief minister, Jayalalithaa Jayaram.

headline.main: Indian State in Mourning After Graft Conviction
headline.print_headline: Indian State in Mourning After Graft Conviction
